utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Who da wenny-Benny boy? You the Wenny-wenny-Benny-Benny boy, yes. Don't cry. Don't cry. Why is he still crying?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Let me hold him for a sec. There. Huh? There we are.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Maye it's me.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Don't be silly. Ben loves you. He's just being Mr. Crankypants.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know, I once dated a Miss Crankypants. Lovely girl, kinda moody.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: There we go. All better.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: There's my little boy.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Can I uh see something?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: He hates me. My nephew hates me.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Come on, don't do this.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What if my own baby hates me? Huh? What am I gonna do then?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Monica, will you stop? This is nuts. Do you know how long it's gonna be before you actually have to deal with this problem? I mean, you don't even have a boyfriend yet. Joey, she does not look fat.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Goo, goo, goo, waaah!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That is so funny. Let me see that.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Are you ok, Ross?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't know. What's in this pie?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Uh, I don't know, butter, eggs, flour, lime, kiwi--

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Kiwi? Kiwi? I thought it was a key lime pie.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No I didn't, I said kiwi lime. That's what makes it so special.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: And that's what's gonna kill me. I'm allergic to kiwi.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No you're not. You're, you're allergic to lobster and peanuts and--oh my god.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ugh. It's definitely getting worse.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Is your tongue swelling up?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Either that or my mouth is getting smaller.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, get your coat, we're going to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Is he gonna be ok?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, he's just gotta get a shot.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You know, you know, actually it's getting better. It is. It is. Let's not go. Anyone for Thcrabble?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Jacket now.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What about Ben? We can't bring a baby to a hospital.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We'll watch him.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't think tho.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What? I have seven Catholic sisters. I've taken care of hundreds of kids. Come on, we wanna do it, don't we?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I was looking forward to playing basketball, but I guess that's out the window.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, well, if you do take him out for his walk, you might wanna bring his hat, and there's extra milk in the fridge, and there's extra diapers in the bag.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hat, milk, got it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: ??? Thro up a thro thro--a thro thro!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Consider it done.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You understood that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, my uncle Sal has a really big tongue.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Is he the one with the beautiful wife?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey Rach, wanna hear the new song I'm thinkin' of singing this afternoon? I wrote it this morning in the shower.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm in the shower and I'm writing a song. Stop me if you've heard it. My skin is soapy, and my hair is wet, and Tegrin spelled backward is Nirget.

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: Uh, Rachel, sweetheart, could I see ya for a minute?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What's up?

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: F.Y.I.. I've decided to pay a professional musician to play in here on Sunday afternoons. Her name is Stephanie... something. She's supposed to be very good.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: But what about Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: Rachel, it's not that your friend is bad, it's that she's so bad, she makes me want to put my finger through my eye into my brain and swirl it around.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, ok, so you're not a fan, but I mean, come on, you cannot do this to her.

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: Uh--

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, no no no no. Oh no no no no. I have to do this to her?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Lather, rinse, repeat, and lather, rinse, repeat, and lather, rinse, repeat, as needed.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know, I don't think we brought enough stuff. Did you forget to pack the baby's anvil?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's gonna be worth it. It's a known fact that women love babies, all righ? Women love guys who love babies. It's that whole sensitive thing. Quick, aim him at that pack o' babes over there. Maybe one of them will break away. No, no wait, for get them, we got one, hard left. All right, gimme the baby.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, I got him.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, seriously.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, seriously you want him?

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: BOYS
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: And who is this little cutie pie?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, don't, don't think me immodest, but, me?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You wanna smell him?

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: I assume we're talking about the baby now.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. He's got that great baby smell. Get a whiff of his head.

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: I think my uterus just skipped a beat.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What'd I tell you? What'd I tell you?

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: I think it's great you guys are doing this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, we are great guys.

utterance.speaker: CAROLINE
utterance.content: You know, my brother and his boyfriend have been trying to adopt for three years. What agency did you two go through?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: But, but this is my gig. This is where I play. My, my name is written out there in chalk. You know, you can't just erase chalk.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Honey, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: And he's going to be paying this woman? Why doesn't he just give her like a throne, and a crown, and like a, you know, gold stick with a ball on top.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Terry is a jerk, ok? That's why we're always saying "Terry's a jerk!" That's where that came from.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, ok. You probably did everything you could.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, you know what, lemme, let me just see what else I can do. All right, look, look. Why don't you just let her go on after Stephanie whatever-her-name-is. I mean, you won't even be here. You don't pay her. It's not gonna cost you anything.

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: I, I don't know.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Come on, Terry, I'll even clean the cappuccino machine.

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: You don't clean the cappuccino machine?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Of course I clean it. I mean, I,I will cleeeean it. I mean, I will cleeeean it.

utterance.speaker: TERRY
utterance.content: Oh, all right, fine, fine, fine.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah. Who's workin' for you babe?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh! Oh my god. This is so exciting. How much am I gonna get?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well you said that he's paying the people who are playing.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, no, no no. I meant that he's gonna be paying that other woman beause she's a professional.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, I'm not gonna be the only one who's not getting paid.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, but Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, huh uh, I'm sorry, no. No, I'm not some like sloppy second, charity band. You know what, there are thousands of places in this city where people would be happy to pay to hear me play. When I play, I play for me, I don't need your charity. Thank you! La la la la la la la....

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, there's no way I'm gonna get a shot. Maybe they can take the needle and thquirt it into my mouth, you know, like a thquirt gun.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Hello, there. I'm Dr. Carlin. I see someone's having an allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Doctor, can I see you for just a minute please? My brother has a slight phobia about needles.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Did you tell him about my thquirt gun idea?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: My brother, the PhD would like to know if there's any way to treat this orally.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: No, under these circumstances it has to be an injection, and it has to be now.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Tho?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ohhh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That's good, have a seat. Um, the doctor says it's gotta be a needle. You're just gonna have to be brave, ok? Can you do that for me?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok. Oh boy. You are doin' so good. You wanna squeeze my hand? All right, Ross, don't squeeze it so hard. Honey, really, don't squeeze it so hard! Oh, Ross! Let go of my hand!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's a good plan, Joe. Next time we wanna pick up women, we should just go to the park and make out. Taxi, taxi!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, look at that talent.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Just practicing. You're good. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, but can you tell him that, because he thinks he's too pink.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh we're not out. No, no. We're just uh, two heterosexual guys, hanging with the son of our other heterosexual friend, doin' the usual straight guy stuff.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You done?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Get outta here. This is our stop too.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, yeah, sure. We live in the building by the uh sidewalk.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know it?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, look, since we're neighbors and all, what do you say we uh, get together for a drink?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, sure, they love us over there.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
utterance.content: Ben! Ben! Ben!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, that's good. Maybe he'll hear you and pull the cord.

utterance.speaker: BOTH
utterance.content: Stop the bus! Wait! Wait! Wait!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Are you sure he didn't break it because it really hurts.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: No, it's just a good bone bruise. And, right here is the puncture wound from your ring.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, I'm really sorry. Sorry. Sorry! Hey! Hey! I got my s's back! Which we can celebrate later. Celebrate.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: ... with the double double double-jointed boy. Hey. So um, are you the professional guitar player?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. I'm Stephanie.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Right. My name was on there, but now it just says "carrot cake". So, um, so um, how many chords do you know?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: All of them.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, so you know D?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, do you know A minor?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, do you know how to go from D to A minor?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok. Um, so does your guitar have a strap?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh. Mine does. Stephanie knows all the chords.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Come on, pick up, pick up! Hello? Transit Authority? Yes, hello. I'm doing research for a book, and I was wondering what someone might do if they left a baby on a city bus. Yes I do realize that would be a very stupid charact er.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hi, here's the deal. We lost a carseat on a bus today. It's white plastic, with a handle, and it fits onto a stroller. Oh, and there was a baby in it. He wants to talk to you again.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh, to Stephanie Schiffer.

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Thank you. I'd like to start with a song that I wrote for the first man I ever loved. Zachary.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You're all invited to bite me!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
utterance.content: Hi. We're the guys who called about the baby. We left the baby on ths bus. Is he here? Is he here?

utterance.speaker: TRANSIT AUTHORITY GUY
utterance.content: He's here. I'm assuming one of you is the father.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's me.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm him.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Actually, uh, we're both the father.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Please tell me you know which one is our baby.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, well that one has ducks on his t-shirt, and this one has clowns. And Ben was definitely wearing ducks.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Or clowns. Oh, oh wait. That one's definitely Ben. Remember, he had that cute little mole by his mouth.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, Ben, remember us? Ok, the mole came off.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ahh!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What're we gonna do? What're we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, uh, we'll flip for it. Ducks or clowns.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, we're gonna flip for the baby?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You got a better idea?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: All right, call it in the air.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Heads.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Heads it is.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yes! Whew!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We have to assign heads to something.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Right. Ok, ok, uh, ducks is heads, because ducks have heads.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What kind of scary-ass clowns came to your birthday?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Here. I thought you might be cold.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Whoa, look at you, you did pretty well.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Eight dollars and 27 cents. But not really, 'cause I put in the first two, just to, you know, get the ball rolling, and to make myself feel better.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. This whole like playing-for-money thing is so not good for me. You know, I don't know, when I sang "Su-Su-Suicide", I got a dollar seventy-five. But then, "Smelly Cat", I got 25 cents and a condom. So you know, now I just feel really bad for Smelly Cat.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, you know, honey, I don't think everybody gets Smelly Cat. You know, I mean, if all you've ever actually had are healthy pets, then, whoosh!

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's not even that. I used to do my songs because it made me happy, but now it's like, it's just all about the money.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, people missed you in there. And in fact, there was actually a request for "Smelly Cat".

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Really? From who?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, from me. And I know it's not your big money song, but it's my favorite.

utterance.speaker: KID
utterance.content: Hi. Uh, did I accidentally drop a condom in your case? It's kind of an emergency.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: KID
utterance.content: Thanks a lot. Hey Christine, I got it!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I just wanna thank you for being there for me today. And I'm sorry I,I almost broke your hand.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That's ok. I'm sorry I poisoned you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, remember the time I jammed that pencil into your hand?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Remember it? What do you think this is, a freckle?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wait, what about the time I hit you in the face with the Silvian's pumpkin?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, man. Oh, remember when I stuck that broom in your bike spokes, and you flipped over and hit your head on the curb?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No. But I remember people telling me about it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I hope Ben has a little sister.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah. I hope she can kick his ass.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm gonna get a new band-aid. Hey, how 'bout the time I cut the legs off your Malibu Ken?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That was you?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: They, uh, were infected. He wouldn't have made it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Aw, my little nephew. Come here, little one. There's my little baby Ben. Hey, my little boy. Hey, he's not crying.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, he's not crying.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yes! There's still pie.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm here. How's my little boy? Want Daddy to change your diaper? So, did you have fun with Uncle Joey and Uncle Chandler today?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, he rode the bus today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ohhh. Big boy, riding the bus--Hey, I have a question. How come it says Property of Human Services on his butt?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You, you are gonna love this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Will you hold Ben for a sec? Come here. Come here.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Stay back, I've got kiwi. Run, Joey, Run!

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, no, no. I'm sorry. It's "smelly cat, smel-ly cat".

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Smelly cat, smel-ly cat...

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Better. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, much better. And you know what, don't feel bad, because it's a hard song.

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You wanna try it again?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. From the top?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, there is no top. That's the beauty of Smelly Cat. Um, why don't you just follow me?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Mmmm hmmm.
